intro: Brachyhelus, commonly known as the short-horned grasshopper, is a genus of orthopteran insects belonging to the family Acrididae. These insects are characterized by their short antennae and robust bodies, typically ranging from 1 to 3 centimeters in length. They are primarily found in grassy habitats across various regions, including temperate and tropical climates. Brachyhelus species are herbivorous, feeding on a variety of plants, particularly grasses and forbs. Their life cycle includes egg, nymph, and adult stages, with nymphs resembling adults but lacking fully developed wings.
